alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amino group attached to a triazine ring.
alternative_parents.name: Aminotriazines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a triazine ring, which is a heterocyclic ring, similar to the six-member benzene ring but with three carbons replaced by nitrogen atoms, at ring positions 1, 3, and 5.
alternative_parents.name: 1,3,5-triazines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing exactly two carboxylic acid groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dicarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organoarsenic compounds in which a carbon is linked to a trivalent arsenic atom.
alternative_parents.name: Trivalent organic arsenic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain at least one carboxyl group and one amino group.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids

alternative_parents.description: Ionic derivatives of carboxylic acid.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid salts

alternative_parents.description: Amines having the nitrogen atom linked to exactly two hydrocarbyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Secondary amines

alternative_parents.description: Organoarsenic compounds that containing an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Oxygen-containing organoarsenic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organoarsenic compounds with the general formula R[As]S, where R = organyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Organoarsenic sulfides

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a metalloid atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metalloid salts

alternative_parents.description: Amines having the nitrogen atom linked to exactly one hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Primary amines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a potassium ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic potassium salts

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aniline and substituted anilines. These are organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.
direct_parent.name: Aniline and substituted anilines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.
subclass.name: Aniline and substituted anilines

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
